docs.text: " through a spyglass , i could see everything . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: king louis xvi was beheaded on january 21 , 1793 , but instead of visualizing this act of regicide , legendary auteur eric rohmer's the lady and the duke observes from afar .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: consider it a view to a kill made abstract .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a proper british ( yes , british ) gentlewoman , grace elliott ( lucy russell ) , and her loyal maidservant gaze from a lofty terrace in meudon at the glistening city of paris , where raucous crowds seem tinier than ants .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the maid narrates what little she sees of the execution through her telescope ( often muttering , " i don't know , " ) as the sound of cheering patriots and revolutionaries echoes through the air .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what we don't see might not be able to hurt us .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: just close your eyes and think of england .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: during times of revolution , the aristocracy may feel a false sense of calm in their parlor halls , discussing tumultuous events over glasses of sherry until the walls cave in on them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: adapted from elliott's memoirs , journal of my life during the french revolution , rohmer's latest artistic tour-de-force may seem far removed from his domestic comedies ( tales of the four seasons , etc . ) , a period film set during the most violent changes in french history .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: resisting the temptation for grand-scale theatrics , much of the lady and the duke is about quiet , decisive moments between members of the cultural elite as they determine how to proceed as the world implodes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: grace elliott makes for an unlikely protagonist : a headstrong , snobbish blueblood , one unprepared for the machinations of history that sweep her along .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a foreigner who accepts the french king as her own , grace's life seems defined by fancy attire and lively political debate with her former lover , the king's hot-blooded cousin , prince philipe , duke of orleans ( jean-claude dreyfus ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the times are changing , though , and the gears inch ever closer toward violence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: during the september massacres of 1792 , she is encountered by a procession of rioters brandishing the head of the duke's sister-in-law on a stake .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rohmer makes a harsh transition from tranquil , old fashioned , almost stagy parlor scenes to the swell of an angry mob .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in doing so , he achieves what braveheart and the patriot could not : the face of death .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when grace sees her friend's disembodied head on a pole , rohmer's attention drifts from the societal change to one woman's reaction shot , laden with hot tears .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: grace finds herself taking in a fugitive from justice , sheltering him from the mob .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: through her relationship with the duke , she seeks a passport for this one activist's escape .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: grace doesn't even understand her own actions ( and the duke reacts in stunned disbelief at how she places herself in such danger ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she endures persecution from robespierre and his gang of thuggish equalizers , ceaseless police monitoring , house searches , even a brief imprisonment for harmless international correspondence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maintaining her stiff upper lip and pampered life ( her imperious attitude to the servants never changes ) , she becomes a heroine through circumstance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the events themselves are intrusions upon her person , her home , and therefore her values .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: aristocracy proves a glass house , one that can barely withstand the upheaval of stones .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the duke is called to vote on the king's punishment , and despite his hours of deliberation with friends and advisors , talk means nothing in the face of bloody action ( or futile inaction ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the episodic structure creates a wobbly , jarring detachment from the events of the french revolution , which serves as metaphor but also disconnects potential audience identification .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lazy viewers ( and critics ) may also complain that knowledge of french history is required for enjoyment of the lady and the duke .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's foolery , but brings up the valid criticism that rohmer's characters occasionally become didactic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rohmer's imperfect but assured push toward the future remains staunch and notable for casting a cautious eye upon the past while taking bold steps forward into an uncertain future .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what may arouse interest in the lady and the duke outside of foreign film enthusiasts with literary and historical passions is rohmer's use of cutting edge digital technology as a means of exploring the theme of artifice as safety net or coping mechanism .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the actors were filmed against a bluescreen , then placed against painted backdrops recreating the vastness of 18th century paris .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this recreation calls attention to itself in every shot , a technicolor dream of fanciful buildings and wide-open streets .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it looks as phony as titanic , but unlike james cameron's debacle , the lady and the duke plays with the notion of false security in those walls of stone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: why ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they aren't real .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the very foundation rohmer's characters stand upon is false , and in their groundlessness they must discover themselves , in all their insubstantial glory .
docs.label: positive
